main event: A witness observed a brilliant, silvery, disc-shaped object moving rapidly at an altitude of approximately 150 feet above the ground near Ann Arbor, Michigan on March 24, 1959.
interesting points: The object was emitting a bright, flashing light and was traveling in a straight line from north to south at a high rate of speed.
The witness observed the object for approximately 15 to 20 seconds before it disappeared from view.
The witness is a resident of the area and was on his way to work when he observed the object.
The witness has no explanation for what he observed and considers the object to be of an unidentified nature.
No other witnesses have reported observing this object.
location: 5 miles NW of Ann Arbor, Michigan
